Package client

Class FabricClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • client.FabricClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    public class FabricClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    The Fabric Client coordinates the allocation of vectors across different servers based on the FabricDispatcher instructions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FabricClient

        public FabricClient()
        Initially, the address of the FabricDispatcher must be known. With the help of the FabricDispatcher, the fabric client later decides on which server the vectors should be stored.

    • Method Detail

      • getHandler

        public VectorHandler getHandler​(java.lang.Class<?> type_of_vector,
                                java.lang.String name,
                                org.example.ArrowFabric.OP op)
        For each vector a dedicated VectorHandler is used.
        Parameters:
        type_of_vector - Class of the vector
        name - Name of the vector
        op - Type of OP which is made on the vector
        Returns:
        VectorHandler that enables working on a vector.
